website_summaries.verdict: While its construction feels flimsy (smaller parts), this corded electric mower offers good power to tackle high or thick grass, yet is easy to lift and store when done.
pros: Relatively lightweight and good power for a corded mower, users report, saying mowing is effortless even over high weeds above 3 inches
Folding handle is a plus for storage
Height adjustment handle is easy to reach
cons: A few reports of small parts breaking after a few uses
Reports of mower failing after several months
Power cord can get in the way
Small hook connecting the safety bar circuit to the starter is flimsy and may break after
At lower height settings, may leave clippings on lawn rather than in bag

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower, Flimsy Crucial Parts
customer_reviews.text: Arrived last week, and was excited to get mowing. Very easy assembly with just the handle bar adjustments and nothing more. Easily adjusts cut height, and does an excellent job cutting overall; I have only used the bagging accessory so far. However, during the first time using it, the hook connecting the starter cable to the handle bar, that you must keep compressed to keep the mower running, snapped in half. Mower won't remain running as the cable just slips out, unattached. Bad part quality? Definitely. Can be easily fixed with tape. Looks a bit janky, especially being brand new. This part really should be a much stronger material as it's crucial to the mower remaining operable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS MODEL LAWNMOWER
customer_reviews.text: I took the lawn mower out of box and noticed the blade was hard to turn. So it started up, I cut my grass which was 3" high cut good until about 10 to 15 minutes. Motor slowed down and died!!! I look underneath clean the grass out and could not move the blade it was frozen. Tried to start 15 minutes later and would not move at all. The item is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: George  K

customer_reviews.title: Typical electric mower: not intended to be high-quality, just serviceable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a model MM875, this mower is meeting my expectations. Plenty of power, and easy to maneuver, and very light. So light, in fact, that it's difficult to pull backwards without "floating" up on the rear guard flap and cutting unevenly. The latches that hold the folding-points on the handles seem fragile, but have worked fine through three mows in heavy grass. The little plastic restraints, that should keep the cords running up the handles out of the way, are already broken/breaking (but these are easily fixed with a couple of cable ties). As claimed, it cuts VERY close to the edges of the deck, doing a nice job against the sides of landscaping timbers.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Driskill

customer_reviews.title: Premature death
customer_reviews.text: I'm done with B&D after this mower froze up 14 months after I bought it . Motor bogged. I rested it but upon using it again it froze in a smokey cloud of ozone stench. I really enjoyed using it. It's under warranty but thr only service center on the Phoenix area of 5 million is 25 miles away open 7 to 4 weekdays only. They say the replacement motor is backordered and have no idea when I can get it back. Terrible support for their products. This is apparently not a rare situation.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Farlow

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER 1 1/2 MONTHS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why my husband keeps having me order these Black & Decker electric lawn mowers. We have had at LEAST 6 of these now. The first one may have lasted 3 years but, the others lasted only about a year and this last one, which I am reviewing, only lasted 1 1/2 months!!! I don't know why he doesn't go with a different manufacturer or a gas mower but, we have had some serious bad luck with this Black & Decker electric mower. Thankfully Amazon offered to make and exception and replace it but, I don't have any hope that it will actually last.
customer_reviews.author: M Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: When this mower arrived, I was delighted with its design and light weight. However, after a months use, the handle began to require constant tightening and attention. Eventually, the plastic adjustable handles wore out and I had to use wire to clamp the two sections together. Towards the end of the mowing season, the motor stopped working, apparently burned out. I have owned other corded electric mowers, including B&D and was impressed. However, this mower has driven me back to a gas-powered unit.
customer_reviews.author: New Fan

customer_reviews.title: Motor went out after less that 3 months. Have ...
customer_reviews.text: Motor went out after less that 3 months. Have a small in town yard. Warranty work was a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dickenson

customer_reviews.title: This does a great job. I use it in mulching configuration and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for several months now. No major complaints. Not a robust build, but it also didn't cost that much. I have a small yard, in a tropical environment, so the grass grows FAST. This does a great job. I use it in mulching configuration and it helps keep the grass green. I'm sure I would love a little more power and cordless...but for the price I'm impressed and satisfied with this purchase. Oh...it folds down pretty compact and doesn't take up much room in my garage. It is also relatively light so picking up by the handles on top isn't too bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCain

customer_reviews.title: Very Efficient , Easy to handle , Nice looking Mower
customer_reviews.text: I had an overgrown property that the landlord was supposed to be mowing but was unable to. So I read a lot and looked a lot of mowers, I wanted electric and light, I got it in this mower and then some, it does a great job, even cutting down very high grass, I was quite surprised to be honest how well it did. I would recommend this Mower to anyone looking to keep their lawn nice looking without working themselves to death. It's a good one for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Skyshield

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked at the quality of this product!!! I have more than 10 other B&D products that has lasted 7+ years & now after using the mower once a week for 2 months, that equals 9 uses the motor stopped working. I'm a veteran at cutting grass so no misuse or abuse caused it... bad, bad, bad!!! If customer service doesn't do anything to help me, I'll never buy any of their products again!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L

customer_reviews.title: This beast is powerful
customer_reviews.text: This mower is a beast. I've had a 12in greeworks electric mower for a while now and over the years it just wasn't enough for my yard. Grass had to be cut fairly regularly or you would stall it constantly. This mower is bigger, stronger, and oddly quiter. The handle positions are fully adjustable and easy to assemble. My grass was tall and slightly damp, and this beast just mowed right through it. Didn't big down or stall once. Made the job really straight forward. Cut really close to the house as well.
customer_reviews.author: dyreno

customer_reviews.title: First Electric Mower
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, packaged well, and very easy to assemble. Love how quiet it is and easy to fold down into a size that fits in storage. Very easy to re-assemble each time. Deck of mower and handle very easy to adjust. Safety handle to engage mower with start button works flawlessly each time. Wish the power cable holder underneath the handle was designed a bit better as the dragging cord, with any electric device, can get stuck on various items, and sometimes a frustration when cord is not as secure or pulls free. Love it and replaced the noisy and smelly gas mower. Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower is precisely what I needed for a bumpy irregular lawn. I leave the grass at about 5" for full thick texture. This mower is the only one anywhere that can do that. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Suoer-quiet and excellent mower.
customer_reviews.text: I have used one of these before and liked it so much I bought one for myself It is a great machine and mulches extremely well. It's super quiet so the neighbors will be happy. The bag works good also. All in all its very well worth the money. I thought about buying a cordless one but you can never depend on batteries and you are at the mercy of waiting until the batteries charge to mow your grass. And when the batteries go out (and they will) they are expensive to replace. If you don't mind an extension cord (I certainly don't) then this is the lawnmower for you.
customer_reviews.author: monci

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for Xmas for my son. 2nd time ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for Xmas for my son. 2nd time he used it this summer it caught fire and burned up. Wouldn't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... I own and it has some new features I like, but it lacks some that I miss
customer_reviews.text: This is the second electric mower that I own and it has some new features I like, but it lacks some that I miss. It's nice and light... I like how it folds and that it has handles to easily pick it up. I also like how low the blade gets (you can cut really close to the ground if you want). I don't like that it seems to leave more cut grass on the lawn than my previous mower (with the bag on, of course), and that it lacks something to facilitate moving the cord from one side to the other when you are changing direction (my previous mower had that), keeping the cord out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well, but some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This mower cuts very well and easy to set up. Two minor complaints. There was a piece missing from the bolt to hold the handle in place on the left hand side (it holds clamp snug). I used a nut as a spacer to make fit snug and secured clamp to handle with gorilla tape. I also had a hard time keeping plug in place. Any sort of tug and I would lose power. I secured plug to handle with gorilla tape, too! Glad I had it on hand! Maybe I should go review gorilla tape!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lallah B.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, works great, easy to use and assemble
customer_reviews.text: It’s as described. We have a fairly large suburban yard and it does the trick - there is just this one corner. I’ll probably plant flowers there and solve the problem (cord doesn’t reach - finding the right cord was a pain).
customer_reviews.author: Barbara F. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sdzen
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing mower. One, it cost me just $199 and two comes almost assembled and very easy to use. My wife was very skeptical when I told her I will be doing the lawn work myself. She was thrilled to see the mower in action. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking to do the yard work themselves. And the best part there’s no mess with GASOLINE. 👍🏿
customer_reviews.author: Sdzen

customer_reviews.title: Works great, quieter than last model
customer_reviews.text: The motor died on my last electric B & D after 7 years. I got this one, came on time, easy to put together - basically, the handle, didn't need any tools. Mows great. I like the other starter better on the handle, but this one is fine. I have a small yard, so the cord isn't an issue. It is quieter than the last one - which is a bonus. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker electric mowers are great
customer_reviews.text: Amazon, you were there to rescue me again when my lawn mower bit the dust. This purchase was exactly what i needed and beat the prices everywhere. These Black and Decker electric mowers are great...as far as being corded, well it's great exercise and makes mowing the lawn more of a challenge which i think is better than lugging around a re-chargable battery, imho
customer_reviews.author: BoHo Chic

customer_reviews.title: I don't imagine I would want this for a HUGE ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't imagine I would want this for a HUGE lawn, but I have a tiny parcel in my front yard that takes about 15 minutes to mow. This thing does the trick. It's lightweight and the assembly only took me about 20 minutes. It's not such a big deal having to watch out for a cord. I mean, if you ever used a vacuum before, it's basically the same thing; don't run over the cord and cover all the area. The bag doesn't hold much, my tiny patch of grass fills it up. All in all, it does the trick and is quiet and saves me money on gas.
customer_reviews.author: rj

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.  Cuts well.  Quiet and lightweight.  Crappy foam on handle not durable
customer_reviews.text: Crappy foam on handle has already split after three cutting sessions. Cuts excellent. Quiet and more powerful than expected. Only downside is stickers on sides of the deck will rub off with use and again, the handle foam is horribly flimsy. Will end up wrapping with grip tape.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and great cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my mower. Clean cuts and very light if not using the mower bag. Awesome that the handle folds down: it takes less room than a gas mower and has a full handle in front to lift if needing to take it up stairs for storage. Only issue I have it that after the second use, the handle on the grass catcher bag ripped off and can no longer use it to carry the full bag. Besides that, great little machine!
customer_reviews.author: reggie38

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it!!! It's a fine lawn mower. Dealing with an extension cord is a pain, but electric mowers overall cost less, require less maintenance and weigh less. This is a lean, mean, grass eating machine! I like it so well that I convinced a lady at True Value Hardware to purchase it instead of the gas mower she was originally considering.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia F. Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love listening to the neighbor struggling to start his gas mower while this just goes. Mower does a great job of throwing the clippings in the bag. No oil, no gasoline, just pkug it in and go. Works for my small lawn
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tire broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Mower seemed fine until the back right tire broke after using the mower about 5 times in 3 months. Really frustrating. Trying to get it repaired but a hassle to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Burke

customer_reviews.title: My last electric mower lasted me 20 years. This ...
customer_reviews.text: My last electric mower lasted me 20 years. This one died in a puff of blue smoke today after less than 2 years service. We did not stall it or abuse it. It just died. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: pdxGreg

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent mower with good height.
customer_reviews.text: It was time to retire my old B&D electric. This new one is quieter, wider and the part I really dig is the handle makes it so that I don't have to bend over to use it. Finding tools for a normal sized 6'1" person isn't the easiest. The world seems to be built for short people. If you are a newbie to electric mowers, the dance with the cord can be a challenge at first but after time of NOT filling it with gas, Not changing the oil every year, Not taking it to get tuned up every year, Not waking your neighbors with the noise you'll see why I switched to electric a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome A. Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Design issues and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that holds the bag is poorly designed and will probably break before long. The hooks are plastic and do not hold the bag securely. Bag often falls off. Handle locking mechanism at the base is flimsy. I would look to other options. Good luck finding an American manufacturer who builds a quality electric mower.
customer_reviews.author: Echoes

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: Great "no frills" lawnmower for those with small yards within easy reach of an extension cord. Power is adequate. Handlebar has quick adjust clamps. Single adjustment level with seven settings. Body is heavy plastic that cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dchap96418

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for small yards
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lawnmower! My previous B&D lasted 17 years. This model is so light weight and easy to maneuver; it’s easier than vacuuming! The blades cut very close to the edge, so I don’t have to use the trimmer as much against the fence. My only criticism is the handle is longer than my previous one, and wrapping the cord around the cord holder took a little practice. The clipper bag is smaller than my previous mower. But overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L Jackson

customer_reviews.title: this is its successor and I'm very pleased. It's quieter
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous model of this Black and Decker mower for about 15 years, this is its successor and I'm very pleased. It's quieter, nice and lightweight so not a chore to mow the grass and it cuts great. Like the improved height adjustments. Looking forward to 15 years with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Di1N

customer_reviews.title: Quieter, lighter & cuts well on 1st pass.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds less like a gas lawnmower & more like a quieter vacuum. No issues at all. Works on medium sized yard & cuts evenly with the first pass.
customer_reviews.author: The Grant Family

customer_reviews.title: I like the range of cutter adjustment heights
customer_reviews.text: The mower works well. I like the range of cutter adjustment heights. I had to jerry-rig a way of connecting the power cord because the extensions I have wouldn't plug into the power cord on the machine. It has a hood around the connecting prongs. No big deal and didn't keep me from using the mower.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power in a lightweight package
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Perfect for my small yard. (Catch bag does not have the welded nub on one side so it mounts losely with some grass escaping)
customer_reviews.author: Zonk 1/75

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box and it worked great. I had an earlier version that I was happy with but I mowed over a rock and tilted the blade. The new one is great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Good for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it 3-4 times since I received it. I does a good job and mulches the grass clippings very finely, i.e. much better, smaller pieces than my gas powered mower.; however, this has a drawback of causing the fine clippings to stick to the inside of the housing.and I must stop and clean it out periodically. It is easy to push and maneuver, except for having to drag the power cord around my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: easy to adjust height mowin. Handle is adjustable for a tall (over 6'2") person. Just know where the cord is and all is well. Quiet.
customer_reviews.author: KMC

customer_reviews.title: This B&W is a worthy successor and I am very pleased with its power and performance
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Toro corded mulching mower and used it for 23 years with very few problems. This B&W is a worthy successor and I am very pleased with its power and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nolde

customer_reviews.title: durable and get's the job done
customer_reviews.text: so far we have enjoyed this mower. It's durable and cuts our grass well. Good for a small to medium yard. Like the mulching or bag option. Hight adjustments are grrat for anyone in the household. Been happy with it so far and by far the best price out there right now.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Liked the MM1800 better but this will do
customer_reviews.text: Liked the MM1800 better but this will do. The increase in crevices in the bottom deck allows caked on grass and dirt to collect making it difficult to clean as did the exposed screws. Unfortunately you can't just spray it out but clean it out gently with a dampened soft cloth. That takes a while. The handle for lifting it into and out of the trunk of my car to take to a friends house to mow is nice but the weight is almost impossible to lift now that all the great improvements make it harder to lift although I can still lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Catt N.

customer_reviews.title: quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: this is the 3rd Black and Decker electric mower that I have owned. This one is the quitest that I have used and cuts a little closer to edges. Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Less power than older version of the same model. Needs more over cut area to compensate. Thick Bermuda/ Fescue mix grass requires 2-3 passes. Good enough for the price. I will buy heavier-duty mower when I kill this one.
customer_reviews.author: michelle s

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly - easy to operate - powerful motor - Works well - recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but didn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: Update: died after 2 years. Motor froze up after high pitch squeal started. Blade won't turn. Thought it would last longer. Disappointed! This thing really revs. sounds like a jet engine. really custs well. Easy to take down and set up. Best I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower is great! We're constantly getting complements on our yard and how great it looks now. I look forward to mowing every week knowing it'll get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running mower, powerful and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: The perfect mower. The cord is not a big hassle. No batteries to charge/replace, no engine oil or tune ups, or starting problems, or gasoline. Folds up and hangs on my garage wall.
customer_reviews.author: G.S. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Dangers Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: This lawnmover get zero stars the first day I use it was smoking and then I start catching on fire. I’m glad I didn’t get hurt and I didn’t put this lawnmower in my garage. It will have gotten really serious. Please don’t buy it
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Redcross

customer_reviews.title: We are happy with this one and if you don't mind to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with starting a unit and had to return it with a quick refund. I have ordered a second one ant hat one is working very well. We are happy with this one and if you don't mind to carry a power cord, I can recommend it to you!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Obereigner

customer_reviews.title: my black and decker electric lawn
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior woman, Putting the handle on was not hard, however making those new type push up things that hold the handle on I just can't tighten them. I worked it out by tying cotton shoe laces around them.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Deckman

customer_reviews.title: High handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle only has two adjustment heights, both of which were a bit too high for me, but I am managing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: I’m 70 and I like doing my own yard.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good option for a small yard, I like not having to deal with gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Stine

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. I've used it twice since receiving it and it works perfectly. Light weight compared to gas lawnmower. Easy to maneuver. I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve due to decreased weight
customer_reviews.text: Very light. Didn't think it would work but it did just fine. Have to remember to press forward and down ap the front end won't keep coming up off the ground
customer_reviews.author: Eron Marer

customer_reviews.title: Handle bars not adjustable to lower height, only two settings, ‘high’ and ‘higher’.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mower as a replacement for prior model MM875 which stopped working after 12 years. Except for being unsuited for shorter people, it’s a good mower and I have a small lawn so I guess I can put up with it. So stupid and irritating to NOT have a full range of height adjustment like the prior model.
customer_reviews.author: Milly

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice mower, but I think they used kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice mower, but I think they used kind of flimsy materials on some areas. On my 3rd time using it the hook connecting the starter cable to the handle bar (that you must keep compressed to keep the mower running) snapped in half. Mower won't remain running as the cable just slips out, unattached. I have used a zip tie to hold it so I can use it, but I'm asking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steinmetz

customer_reviews.title: Surprised us
customer_reviews.text: We were impressed how well this cut very overgrown grass after the Hurricane, "Knee high in some areas" I'm over 6'3. Our landscaper said it would take him and his employee an hour to do. This took us 20-30 minutes using level 5 height worked best for us.
customer_reviews.author: GOD's Soldier

customer_reviews.title: Best mower for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Super light, easy to fold, works great. I have a small lawn and this bad boy mowed through it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Nasir Iqbal

customer_reviews.title: switch breaks defective design.
customer_reviews.text: I am changing this review to 1 star from 4 because the switch mechanism stopped working after a year of use. Black and decker said it would be covered under warranty but because the closest repair place is so far, I'd have to ship it. To their credit black and decker said they would send a pre-paid ups mailing label. But I don't have a box. Anyway don't buy any black and deckmower with this switch. My 10 year old black and decker still runs and is bettter made than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Thurlow

customer_reviews.title: It works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new lawn mower! It is lightweight and gets the job done! Should have gone electric a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Ms

customer_reviews.title: No problems fast servise
customer_reviews.text: This is what I needed. It works great and came very fast
customer_reviews.author: thomas krolikowski

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Mower was great... for a few weeks. Light and powerful, I was halfway through the 3rd use when it died. Going to try the BEMW213 model and hope the issue was addressed in production.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Does a good job at cutting. The cord can be a hassle sometimes. Be very aware of where the cord is at all times so you don't run it over. Overall, perfect mower for my small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Steph C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this mower
customer_reviews.text: Love this mower. This is my third. Easy to use and not too heavy. Cord is not a big deal once you develop a pattern to do your yard.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Go electric
customer_reviews.text: Very well easy to use cuts great. Just watch for the cord
customer_reviews.author: deniz buyukacaroglu

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about three years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in July 2017. Motor stopped working yesterday, September 7, 2020. I think it should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Worst Purchase Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever purchased. The first one broke after first use so I got a replacement one. But guess what, the second one broke after first use as well.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: best mower i ever had
customer_reviews.text: wow, best mower i ever had. pushes easy weights almost nothing starts on the first pull. (oh brother). buy it buy it buy it.
customer_reviews.author: qmodem

customer_reviews.title: Economical and effective
customer_reviews.text: This mower is great. It is lightweight, quiet and cuts well. I have used it mostly in mulching mode and it has not bogged down even in fairly high grass. The mower blade cuts very close to the left edge so it is very effective in cutting close to obstacles. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: Crappy mower. Had to get it replace, replacement didn't work out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This mower died after 3 months of use (maybe 7 times total). Worked with Black and Decker to get a replacement, came out of the box and didn't work (brand new). Find a different mower or be sorry. Black and Decker lost my business with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Easy to operate! It has quick release clips to collapse, which I do after use. Fits in small shed.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Lousy mulching, cuts better with grass catcher
customer_reviews.text: After one summer the rubber flapper plate on the back tore and it flaps underneath and won't return. Even with sharp blades and the underside very clean, this mower does a lousy job mulching. It cannot even handle a 1" cut on dry grass without leaving a trail of cut grass clumps along the left side after it mows. I would not recommend this mower.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: A great lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine! Corded electric machine .. no battery to charge or purchase, no gas to buy .. virtually no maintenance required. lighter than expected .. A+. Previous version (Hog) lasted for 12 years . i expect to keep it for another 12 years!
customer_reviews.author: native

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I'm just unlucky
customer_reviews.text: If it didn't die on me the first time I used it I'd be happier.
customer_reviews.author: John Evans

customer_reviews.title: This is the best electric lawn mower I have found
customer_reviews.text: I've used electric mowers exclusively for the past 40+ years. This is the best electric lawn mower I have found. It is really user-friendly, being light weight and easy to maneuver. It's like a "sports car" of electric mowers!
customer_reviews.author: R. Steven Call

customer_reviews.title: Great mower!
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller Black & Decker power mower but was replaced by this one. I love it! Gets the job done effortlessly and the "fold away handle" is a huge plus! This mower has everything I wish my older/small one had. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery!!
customer_reviews.text: Would have received 5 stars but handle bolts required 4 washers for proper stability. However, light weight with easy handling and expected quality otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Very powerfull mower
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this mower a couple of times, but it has a lot of power. Be sure to use a good cord. I burnt up an eletric mower before because the cord was too long and did not have the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: So far a great experience. The only downside is the instructions have ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, assembled the unit(handles) it started up first try and the lawn got its first haircut. So far a great experience. The only downside is the instructions have pictures - all black and white - and not necessarily easy to distinguish the part or proper position angle they are describing. Maureen
customer_reviews.author: maureen c

customer_reviews.title: Totally plastic but has held up just fine and cuts the grass well
customer_reviews.text: Had it a couple of years. Totally plastic but has held up just fine and cuts the grass well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Superb mover
customer_reviews.text: Solid mower! It really has the power needed to chop thick grass! My last electrical mover died and after looking around, his was the best price/performance ratio for the budget! Maybe sharpen the mower blades a bit before use. Something that I personally did
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: The bagger works great. Much better than my old gas mower even
customer_reviews.text: The bagger works great. Much better than my old gas mower even. I like the quick connects on the handle and the hand hold. It is easy to store in places you would never put a gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: gvilleeric

customer_reviews.title: I bought it and love it. It has plenty of power and is ...
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would own an electric lawnmower but I needed a mower and saw the reviews on the Black & Decker 13amp model. I bought it and love it. It has plenty of power and is light weight and easy to adjust the cutting height. You can bag, or mulch or use the side discharge and it folds down when not in use. I can easily pick it up and put it in the shed after use. I LOVE this mower, just make sure you have a 14awg or 12awg extension cord that is capable of running 13 amps
customer_reviews.author: Todd Huntley

customer_reviews.title: Powercord consideration
customer_reviews.text: Need to pay close attention to the electrical cord. Haven't cut the extension cord...yet! Overall, this is a nice machine and cuts evenly for the cost of this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I was going way out on a limb making ...
customer_reviews.text: I felt like I was going way out on a limb making this purchase. Never had an electric lawn mower before so I basically relied on the comments provided by others. This purchase was a total win. the mower was super easy to assemble, it's so light weight and more than able to mow my lawn which had gotten pretty tall by the time it arrived. Downside is wrangling the cord, but I am more than willing to trade that for being able to store the mower in the basement (no garage) and no more smelly gas fumes,
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: I  Love It
customer_reviews.text: I like everything: light, easy to handle, you do the job in half the time. I do love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A Torres

customer_reviews.title: Has been working well.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for almost a year. Easy to work and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Samie

customer_reviews.title: junk mower
customer_reviews.text: piece of crap mower. motor burnt out after two uses!! dont buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted but too heavy for the USPS
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, quiet, and compact. Just what I wanted. Amazon should not ship this size package with the US Postal Service. My mail carrier left a note in my box that said the item was undeliverable. I had to take off work to go to the Post Office and pick it up 'cause the mail carrier said it was too heavy for her.
customer_reviews.author: SwamiTommy

customer_reviews.title: REPLACEMENT MOWER IS NO BETTER THAN THE FIRST PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: REPLACEMENT ASSEMBLED MAY 17, 2018. MOWED BACK YARD ON JULY 4, JULY 18, AND AUGUST 7. MULCHED LEAVES ON 1/3 OF BACK YARD ON OCTOBER 9, AND OCTOBER 13. WHILE MULCHING ON OCTOBER 24, MOWER STOPPED AND WILL NOT START AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Drake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It is so easy and smooth to maneuver. Also, I was impressed with how quick it was delivered especially during the COVID-19 virus. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: This mower replaces a Black and Decker MM875 which died ...
customer_reviews.text: This mower replaces a Black and Decker MM875 which died after 10 years of use. This model has an improved wheel height lever and starter. Only negative so far is the bag. It is very difficult to remove and reattach.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Never going back to a gas mower. I have about 1/2 acre of rough lawn. Works wonderfully. Electric cord takes some getting used to, especially if you buy a 100' heavy duty cord: It's heavy. But worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does an excellent job
customer_reviews.text: Pros:I have a small backyard that's 14' X 18'. The weed grew up 2'-4' in height. This lawn mower demolished those weeds without making a mistake. It's perfect for a small backyard renovation project. The mulching was superb. It functioned very well. Cons: The cons happened due to my limited experience in lawn care. Make sure you have long cable s that can handle 13 Amp equipment. Be careful using the orange locking clamps for handle bars - if they're tighten too much, they break off. Get used to starting it up: squeeze the throttle / trigger bar first and while it's engaged push the red start button. Once the squeeze bar is released, the electric motor deactivates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was designed well and I like the product
customer_reviews.text: This was designed well and I like the product. I have two quibbles: (1) there is no means to attach the power cord to the handle. I must tie it in a loop so that the power connection point doesn't dangle and potentially disconnect. (2) is the bag catcher. It is a very tight fit made worse on hot days. Other than that, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: World Phamous

customer_reviews.title: Good torque and light
customer_reviews.text: Good torque and light. Refreshing after a gas dog mower. I hate to crank crank crank crank crank crank & crank. Nevermore!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love the mower powerful enough to do what I wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the mower powerful enough to do what I wanted it to do. easy adjustment on the Cutting Height. Light weight easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good for environment.
customer_reviews.text: So quiet and starts with a push of a button. It was so easy to push. Really makes cutting grass easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Electric lawnmowers are way better.
customer_reviews.text: Loved my first black & decker lawnmower now this one will be great. Light weight and cuts the grass great.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin 3rd

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Lawn Mower, Corded, 13-Amp, 20-Inch (MM2000)
product_meta.description: The Black & Decker MM2000 The Black & Decker 20 in. Electric Walk-Behind Push Mower provides clean, reliable electric power and instant starting every time. It sports a powerful 13-Amp motor for bagging, mulching and side discharging. The EdgeMax deck design allows cutting up to the edge of fencing and flower beds, providing a clean and manicured lawn fast. This mower features a 20-inch wide cutting patch, with a 7-setting height adjustment that allows choosing the height of cut between 1-1/2 Inch to 4 Inch. It offers a convenient carrying handles for easy transport and storage. The 13 gallon all nylon grass collection bag allows for checking fill levels. This mower is backed by Black & Decker's 2 year limited warranty. What's included: (1) Mower, (1) grass bag and (1) manual.
feature_bullets: 7-setting height adjustment from 1-1/2 inch to 4 inches high
Included Components: (1) Mower, (1) Grass collection bag; Power Source: Electric

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
